definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

pinyin: xuan1 shi4 gong4 ci2 zheng4 ming2

sentences.english: He himself showed up at the cells in Newgate to take depositions from the men he caught.
sentences.chinese: 他自己发现这些细胞在纽盖特到从他被捕的男子供词。

sentences.english: Having no confession is a focus of Qiu Jins unjust case before her death.
sentences.chinese: 秋瑾死前没有供词是秋瑾冤案的一个焦点。

sentences.english: Some defendants’ confessions even include mistakes fed by the police.
sentences.chinese: 一些被告的供词甚至包含警方提供的错误。

sentences.english: Requirements for recording confessions vary widely across the country.
sentences.chinese: 对于记录供词的要求在全国范围内很不一样。

sentences.english: She later recanted the confession and has denied wrongdoing, he said.
sentences.chinese: 她后来否认自己的供词，并否认有任何过错，他说。

sentences.english: Zhi Wei has doubts over Zhen Yuan's statement but is unable to find evidence.
sentences.chinese: 志伟对振源的供词始终有怀疑，但却找不到证据。

sentences.english: A confession. A confession, written by the baby’s father.
sentences.chinese: 那是一份供词，是孩子的父亲写的。

sentences.english: His clumsy tongue had finally forced this foolish confession past the teeth.
sentences.chinese: 他那拙劣的舌头总算把这份愚蠢的供词挤出了牙缝。

sentences.english: The confession was made under torture.
sentences.chinese: 这份供词是严刑逼供得来的。

sentences.english: His story was not believed and he soon after signed two separate confessions.
sentences.chinese: 这种解释没有得到采信，不久他签下两份独立供词。
他的供词使大家都感到意外。

definition: oral confession (as opposed to 筆供|笔供[bi3 gong4])/statement/deposition
to retract testimony/to withdraw a confession
